term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - wet bulb temperature
term.title: wet bulb temperature

item.text: In psychrometry, the temperature of the sensor or the bulb of a thermometer in which a constantly renewed film of water is evaporating. The temperature of the water used to renew the film must be at the temperature of the gas.

sources.item: PAC, 1990, 62, 2167. 'Glossary of atmospheric chemistry terms (Recommendations 1990)' on page 2219 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199062112167)
